segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine, and today we've got some kids for you in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们有一些孩子在这个对话中。

segments.en: They're doing something that's very common in America.
segments.cn: 他们正在做一些在美国非常常见的事情。

segments.en: I'm not so sure if it's common elsewhere, but we'll find that out later.
segments.cn: 我不太确定在其他地方是否也常见，但我们稍后会知道。

segments.en: So today we're going to ask for money because we are having a fundraiser.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们要筹款，因为我们正在进行一次募捐活动。

segments.en: So this is a very interesting word.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常有趣的词。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at it in vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不在词汇预览中看看它呢。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 词汇预览。

segments.en: So a fundraiser is a thing.
segments.cn: 募捐活动是一种事情。

segments.en: It's an event.
segments.cn: 这是一项活动。

segments.en: It's something that you do at a school or a business to try and collect money for a special event or charity.
segments.cn: 这是你在学校或企业中进行的事情，试图为某个特殊活动或慈善事业筹集资金。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So money, you can also say, is funds, right?
segments.cn: 所以资金，你也可以说是资金，对吧？

segments.en: And that's what you're trying to do.
segments.cn: 这就是你要做的。

segments.en: You're trying to collect.
segments.cn: 你在试图收集。

segments.en: You're trying to gather a lot of money or funds in order for, like you say, some sort of objective purpose.
segments.cn: 你在试图聚集大量资金，以便像你说的那样，达到某种目标。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: But it's not just like we're having a fundraiser to earn more profits this year.
segments.cn: 但这不仅仅是为了赚取更多利润。

segments.en: It's usually an event that's for some kind of charity or good cause.
segments.cn: 通常这是为某种慈善或公益事业而举办的活动。

segments.en: So, for example, the company is having a fundraiser for Jenny's child because he's sick and they can't pay for medical care.
segments.cn: 例如，这家公司正在为Jenny的孩子筹款，因为他生病了，他们无法支付医疗费用。

segments.en: So a fundraiser is for a good cause.
segments.cn: 所以募捐活动是为了一个好原因。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So that's what this dialogue is all about today.
segments.cn: 所以今天这个对话就是关于这个的。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不听听。

segments.en: the Okay, Mark, it's your turn to ring the doorbell.
segments.cn: 好吧，Mark，该你按门铃了。

segments.en: I did it last time.
segments.cn: 上次是我按的。

segments.en: I hate going door to door and I hate asking for money.
segments.cn: 我讨厌挨家挨户地去，讨厌要钱。

segments.en: But we need to raise enough money for the school fundraiser so that our class can win the pizza party.
segments.cn: 但我们需要为学校的募捐活动筹集足够的资金，以便我们的班级能赢得披萨派对。

segments.en: You do want to have a pizza party, don't you?
segments.cn: 你想要披萨派对，对吧？

segments.en: Yes, but... Just go already.
segments.cn: 是的，但……快去吧。

segments.en: No one's coming.
segments.cn: 没人来。

segments.en: Try again.
segments.cn: 再试一次。

segments.en: Maybe there's no one home.
segments.cn: 也许家里没人。

segments.en: Of course there's someone home.
segments.cn: 当然有人在家。

segments.en: There are two cars in the driveway and I can see lights on in the house.
segments.cn: 车道上有两辆车，我能看到屋里有灯亮着。

segments.en: Hello?
segments.cn: 你好？

segments.en: Anybody home?
segments.cn: 有人在家吗？

segments.en: We would like to know if you want to sponsor us in our school fundraiser.
segments.cn: 我们想知道您是否愿意赞助我们的学校募捐活动。

segments.en: 50% of the profits go towards the new school playground.
segments.cn: 利润的50%将用于新的学校游乐场。

segments.en: I don't know why anyone would want what's in this catalogue anyway.
segments.cn: 我不知道为什么任何人会想要这个目录里的东西。

segments.en: It's just a bunch of tacky Christmas ornaments.
segments.cn: 这只是一堆俗气的圣诞装饰品。

segments.en: Cities of old people singing Christmas songs and special crackers and cheeses and boxes of chocolates.
segments.cn: 一些老人在唱圣诞歌，还有特别的饼干和奶酪以及巧克力盒。

segments.en: You don't like chocolate?
segments.cn: 你不喜欢巧克力吗？

segments.en: Not this kind.
segments.cn: 不喜欢这种。

segments.en: They've got weird names like Ganache and Praline.
segments.cn: 它们有奇怪的名字，比如Ganache和Praline。

segments.en: Look, I just saw someone walking around inside.
segments.cn: 看，我刚才看到有人在里面走动。

segments.en: These people are being very rude.
segments.cn: 这些人真无礼。

segments.en: Finally, someone's coming.
segments.cn: 终于，有人来了。

segments.en: They don't look too happy.
segments.cn: 他们看起来不太高兴。

segments.en: Hi, sir.
segments.cn: 你好，先生。

segments.en: Would you like to sponsor us or make a donation to... What grade are you kids in?
segments.cn: 您想赞助我们还是捐款给……你们上几年级？

segments.en: Grade 7.
segments.cn: 七年级。

segments.en: Then for goodness sake, don't you see this sign?
segments.cn: 那你难道没看到这个标志吗？

segments.en: Can't you read?
segments.cn: 你看不懂吗？

segments.en: No soliciting?
segments.cn: 不允许推销？

segments.en: All right, so obviously the kids are selling candy and a lot of different things for their new playground.
segments.cn: 好吧，显然孩子们在为他们的新游乐场卖糖果和其他东西。

segments.en: That's the fundraiser, right?
segments.cn: 这就是募捐活动，对吧？

segments.en: Mm -hmm.
segments.cn: 嗯-嗯。

segments.en: So they use a lot of interesting words and phrases there.
segments.cn: 所以他们使用了很多有趣的词汇和短语。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at a couple of them on Language Takeaway?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不在语言收获中看看其中几个呢？

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言收获。

segments.en: Well, the first word is one that Marco, you've already talked a little bit about today.
segments.cn: 好吧，第一个词是Marco，你今天已经谈到过一点。

segments.en: We talked about fundraiser to raise.
segments.cn: 我们谈到了募捐活动来筹集。

segments.en: Well, we do have the verb here to raise enough money.
segments.cn: 我们这里有动词“筹集足够的资金”。

segments.en: So raise is a verb that means to collect or gather or to get.
segments.cn: 所以“筹集”是一个动词，意思是收集或聚集或获得。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you wouldn't really say we are collecting money or we are gathering money.
segments.cn: 所以你不会真的说我们在收集钱或我们在聚集钱。

segments.en: You say we are raising money for the victims of the earthquake in Haiti.
segments.cn: 你会说我们在为海地地震的受害者筹集资金。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So the reason we don't say we are earning money is because you're not doing any work.
segments.cn: 所以我们不说我们在赚取资金的原因是因为你并没有做任何工作。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Really, you're not going to the job at 9 o'clock and leaving the job at 5 o'clock.
segments.cn: 其实，你并不是在9点钟上班，5点钟下班。

segments.en: You're actually asking people for donations.
segments.cn: 你实际上是在向人们请求捐款。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So that's what you're doing.
segments.cn: 所以这就是你在做的。

segments.en: You are raising money.
segments.cn: 你在筹集资金。

segments.en: And now moving on, another way that you can help people maybe through a charity or donation is also to sponsor.
segments.cn: 现在继续，另一种你可以通过慈善或捐款帮助人们的方式是赞助。

segments.en: To sponsor someone or something.
segments.cn: 赞助某人或某事。

segments.en: Okay, so people can sponsor events or people and companies can also do this as well.
segments.cn: 好吧，人们可以赞助活动或个人，公司也可以这样做。

segments.en: So to sponsor someone is basically to give them money in support of a cause.
segments.cn: 所以赞助某人基本上是给他们钱以支持某个事业。

segments.en: For example, have you ever done one of those 5k runs or 10k runs?
segments.cn: 例如，你有没有参加过5公里或10公里的跑步？

segments.en: Did you have to collect sponsors basically to find people who would help pay money for you to do this run?
segments.cn: 你是否需要收集赞助者，基本上找到愿意为你支付这次跑步的人？

segments.en: Not personally, but I know people who have, who actually get companies interested.
segments.cn: 我个人没有，但我知道有些人这样做，他们实际上让公司感兴趣。

segments.en: And maybe that person, for example, is going to run five kilometers in this race in order to raise money for victims of some serious illness.
segments.cn: 也许那个人，例如，打算在这场比赛中跑五公里，以筹集资金帮助一些严重疾病的受害者。

segments.en: And so they get sponsors, they get companies to donate money for this cause.
segments.cn: 所以他们获得赞助者，让公司为这个事业捐款。

segments.en: You could have a person or a company sponsor you.
segments.cn: 你可以有一个人或一个公司赞助你。

segments.en: They could be your sponsor by giving you money that you can then use for this charity or special cause.
segments.cn: 他们可以通过给你钱来成为你的赞助者，然后你可以用这些钱用于这个慈善或特殊事业。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: But the difference between a fundraiser and to sponsor something or someone is that sponsoring is not always for a charity or for some sort of non-profit cause, right?
segments.cn: 但募捐活动和赞助某事或某人的区别在于，赞助不总是用于慈善或某种非营利事业，对吧？

segments.en: We have many sponsors for concerts or for sporting events.
segments.cn: 我们有很多音乐会或体育赛事的赞助商。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So oftentimes when you see athletes, they have their sponsors or their sponsors' logos written all over their jerseys, the clothes that they wear.
segments.cn: 所以当你看到运动员时，他们的赞助商或赞助商的标志通常写在他们的球衣和他们穿的衣服上。

segments.en: So for example, if you're watching Formula One racing, you see the Ferrari and the bank emblems and all these different things.
segments.cn: 例如，如果你在看一级方程式赛车，你会看到法拉利和银行的标志以及所有这些不同的东西。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So those are different ways of sponsoring events or people.
segments.cn: 所以这些是赞助活动或个人的不同方式。

segments.en: And now moving on, we have a word that's, well, not really related to money and fundraisers, but it's a very interesting word and very common.
segments.cn: 现在继续，我们有一个词，嗯，和钱及募捐活动不太相关，但这是一个非常有趣且非常常见的词。

segments.en: When the kids mentioned that they're selling a bunch of tacky Christmas ornaments.
segments.cn: 当孩子们提到他们在卖一堆俗气的圣诞装饰品时。

segments.en: Tacky.
segments.cn: 俗气。

segments.en: Tacky.
segments.cn: 俗气。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: You're going to hear this a lot.
segments.cn: 你会经常听到这个。

segments.en: And the interesting thing about the word tacky is that it means something different to everyone.
segments.cn: 有趣的是，"tacky"这个词对每个人的意思都不同。

segments.en: So what I think is tacky might be just normal for Marco.
segments.cn: 所以我认为tacky的东西对Marco来说可能只是正常。

segments.en: And what Marco thinks is really tacky might be something that I actually like.
segments.cn: 而Marco认为非常tacky的东西可能是我实际上喜欢的。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And so tacky is basically a bad thing.
segments.cn: 所以tacky基本上是个坏东西。

segments.en: It means something is not good looking or not very...
segments.cn: 它意味着某样东西不好看或不太...

segments.en: Not very... Fashionable.
segments.cn: 不太... 时尚。

segments.en: Fashionable.
segments.cn: 时尚。

segments.en: It's like in bad taste.
segments.cn: 就像是品味不好。

segments.en: But as you say, taste is something subjective, right?
segments.cn: 但正如你所说，品味是主观的，对吧？

segments.en: So maybe, for example... Sometimes we say that when girls wear too much makeup, it's very tacky.
segments.cn: 所以例如... 有时我们说女孩化妆太多是非常tacky。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Bright red lipstick and blue eyeshadow.
segments.cn: 明亮的红色口红和蓝色眼影。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So a guy might say, oh, that's so tacky.
segments.cn: 所以一个男孩可能会说，哦，那太tacky了。

segments.en: Whereas another person might not think it's tacky at all.
segments.cn: 而另一个人可能根本不觉得它tacky。

segments.en: So this happens a lot, and we use this word a lot with decorations, for example.
segments.cn: 这种情况经常发生，我们经常用这个词来形容装饰，比如说。

segments.en: For someone's house, you might describe it as tacky or a restaurant or a bar.
segments.cn: 对于某人的房子，你可能会形容它为tacky，或者一个餐厅或酒吧。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So for maybe sometimes those Italian restaurants that have the red and white checkered tablecloths and other pictures of the Italians with the mustaches, I might think that's a little bit tacky.
segments.cn: 所以也许有时那些意大利餐厅有红白格子桌布和其他意大利人留着胡子的图片，我可能会觉得那有点tacky。

segments.en: But maybe you think it's cute.
segments.cn: 但也许你觉得它很可爱。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So something that's tacky.
segments.cn: 所以tacky的东西。

segments.en: And as we say, people use it all the time.
segments.cn: 正如我们所说，人们一直在使用它。

segments.en: And it's not necessarily a bad thing.
segments.cn: 而这不一定是坏事。

segments.en: You can just say, oh, it's a little bit tacky.
segments.cn: 你可以说，哦，这有点tacky。

segments.en: Or I think this thing is a little bit tacky.
segments.cn: 或者我觉得这个东西有点tacky。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And that's it, right?
segments.cn: 就这样，对吧？

segments.en: Solicit.
segments.cn: 征求。

segments.en: Solicit.
segments.cn: 征求。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And our final word on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 这是我们关于语言的最后一个要点。

segments.en: Towards the end of the dialogue, when the kids were reading the sign, the sign said, no soliciting.
segments.cn: 在对话的最后，当孩子们在读标志时，标志上写着“禁止推销”。

segments.en: And they didn't understand what that means.
segments.cn: 他们不明白这是什么意思。

segments.en: What does it mean when you have a sign that says no soliciting?
segments.cn: “禁止推销”是什么意思？

segments.en: Okay, so to solicit is to try to sell something or to offer a service.
segments.cn: 好的，推销是试图销售某物或提供服务。

segments.en: So basically, the sign means please don't come to my house and sell me stuff.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，这个标志的意思是请不要来我家卖东西。

segments.en: For example, we have door to door insurance salesmen or makeup salespeople.
segments.cn: 例如，我们有上门的保险推销员或化妆品推销员。

segments.en: And these people go to your door and they try to sell you their product.
segments.cn: 这些人会到你家门口，试图向你推销他们的产品。

segments.en: And no soliciting means don't come to my house.
segments.cn: 而“禁止推销”意味着不要来我家。

segments.en: I'm not going to answer the door if you're trying to sell something.
segments.cn: 如果你试图卖东西，我不会开门。

segments.en: So to solicit is to try and sell something.
segments.cn: 所以推销是试图销售某物。

segments.en: Okay, but usually in person trying to make a sale uninvited, right?
segments.cn: 好的，但通常是面对面地试图进行未邀请的销售，对吧？

segments.en: Because if you're a businessman and you have a meeting, a sales meeting, you're not really soliciting with that other person.
segments.cn: 因为如果你是商人，有一个销售会议，你并不是在和那个人推销。

segments.en: No, this is basically trying to sell something to a stranger.
segments.cn: 不，这基本上是试图向陌生人销售某物。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So a lot of interesting words there.
segments.cn: 所以有很多有趣的词。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to the dialogue again?
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍对话吧？

segments.en: And we'll be back shortly with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们很快会回来进行流利度提升。

segments.en: Okay, Mark, it's your turn to ring the doorbell.
segments.cn: 好的，Mark，该你按门铃了。

segments.en: I did it last time.
segments.cn: 上次是我按的。

segments.en: I hate going door to door and I hate asking for money.
segments.cn: 我讨厌挨家挨户地去，讨厌要钱。

segments.en: But we need to raise enough money for the school fundraiser so that our class can win the pizza party.
segments.cn: 但我们需要为学校筹款筹集足够的钱，这样我们的班级才能赢得披萨派对。

segments.en: You do want to have a pizza party, don't you?
segments.cn: 你想要披萨派对，对吧？

segments.en: Yes, but... Just go already.
segments.cn: 是的，但是...快去吧。

segments.en: No one's coming.
segments.cn: 没人来。

segments.en: Try again.
segments.cn: 再试一次。

segments.en: Maybe there's no one home.
segments.cn: 也许家里没人。

segments.en: Of course there's someone home.
segments.cn: 当然有人在家。

segments.en: There are two cars in the driveway and I can see lights on in the house.
segments.cn: 车道上有两辆车，我能看到屋里有灯亮着。

segments.en: Hello?
segments.cn: 你好？

segments.en: Anybody home?
segments.cn: 有人在家吗？

segments.en: We would like to know if you want to sponsor us in our school fundraiser.
segments.cn: 我们想知道你是否愿意赞助我们的学校筹款活动。

segments.en: 50% of the profits go towards the new school playground.
segments.cn: 利润的50%将用于新的学校游乐场。

segments.en: I don't know why anyone would want what's in this catalogue anyway.
segments.cn: 我不知道为什么任何人会想要这个目录里的东西。

segments.en: It's just a bunch of tacky Christmas ornaments.
segments.cn: 这只是一堆tacky的圣诞装饰品。

segments.en: Cities of old people singing Christmas songs and special crackers and cheeses and boxes of chocolates.
segments.cn: 一些老人在唱圣诞歌，还有特别的饼干和奶酪以及巧克力盒。

segments.en: You don't like chocolate?
segments.cn: 你不喜欢巧克力吗？

segments.en: Not this kind.
segments.cn: 不喜欢这种。

segments.en: They've got weird names like Ganache and Praline.
segments.cn: 它们有奇怪的名字，比如Ganache和Praline。

segments.en: Look, I just saw someone walking around inside.
segments.cn: 看，我刚才看到有人在里面走动。

segments.en: These people are being very rude.
segments.cn: 这些人非常无礼。

segments.en: Finally, someone's coming.
segments.cn: 最后，有人来了。

segments.en: They don't look too happy.
segments.cn: 他们看起来不太高兴。

segments.en: Hi sir, would you like to sponsor us or make a donation to...
segments.cn: 你好，先生，你想赞助我们还是捐款给...

segments.en: What grade are you kids in?
segments.cn: 你们上几年级？

segments.en: Grade 7.
segments.cn: 七年级。

segments.en: Then for goodness sake, don't you see this sign?
segments.cn: 那你们难道没看到这个标志吗？

segments.en: Can't you read?
segments.cn: 你们看不懂吗？

segments.en: No soliciting?
segments.cn: 禁止推销？

segments.en: All right, so now we're back and we have four key phrases for you on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们回来了，我们有四个关键短语给你们进行流利度提升。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利度提升。

segments.en: Okay, this first phrase is a pretty common one.
segments.cn: 好的，第一个短语是一个相当常见的短语。

segments.en: We wanted to make sure that everyone was comfortable with the verb that goes with doorbells.
segments.cn: 我们想确保每个人都对与门铃相关的动词感到舒适。

segments.en: So Marco, what do you do to a doorbell?
segments.cn: 所以Marco，你对门铃做什么？

segments.en: You ring the doorbell.
segments.cn: 你按门铃。

segments.en: You ring the doorbell.
segments.cn: 你按门铃。

segments.en: So you don't touch it, you don't press it.
segments.cn: 所以你不触碰它，不按它。

segments.en: You can press it, but you ring the doorbell.
segments.cn: 你可以按，但你按门铃。

segments.en: That's the verb.
segments.cn: 这就是动词。

segments.en: Okay, so for example, when I was little, my brother and I always used to fight about who could ring the doorbell.
segments.cn: 好的，例如，当我小时候，我和我哥哥总是争谁能按门铃。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: I loved ringing the doorbell and so did he.
segments.cn: 我喜欢按门铃，他也是。

segments.en: Do you do the long ring or do you do the... Ding, ding, ding, ding, ding, ding.
segments.cn: 你是长按还是...叮，叮，叮，叮，叮，叮。

segments.en: You do it like that.
segments.cn: 你就这样做。

segments.en: The annoying ring.
segments.cn: 讨厌的铃声。

segments.en: Yeah, so to ring the doorbell.
segments.cn: 是的，所以按门铃。

segments.en: All right, all right.
segments.cn: 好吧，好吧。

segments.en: And well, going back, when we were talking about no soliciting, you said that salespeople go door-to-door selling things.
segments.cn: 回到我们谈到的禁止推销，你说推销员挨家挨户地卖东西。

segments.en: So this is an interesting phrase and it's a fixed phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个有趣的短语，是一个固定短语。

segments.en: Going door-to-door.
segments.cn: 挨家挨户。

segments.en: Well, think about it.
segments.cn: 嗯，想想看。

segments.en: So a salesperson who wants to sell maybe some makeup goes to one house and no one wants to buy any makeup there.
segments.cn: 所以一个想卖化妆品的推销员去一个家，但那里没有人想买化妆品。

segments.en: So she goes to the next house.
segments.cn: 所以她去下一个家。

segments.en: So she's going from house to house, but we don't really say house to house because she's going to your door to offer the makeup.
segments.cn: 她是挨家挨户，但我们不真的说挨家挨户，因为她是去你家门口推销化妆品。

segments.en: So we just say going door-to-door.
segments.cn: 所以我们就说挨家挨户。

segments.en: That means going to strangers' homes in order, one door after the next, to sell something.
segments.cn: 这意味着去陌生人的家，一个接一个地去卖东西。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: You go door-to-door.
segments.cn: 你挨家挨户。

segments.en: So for example, someone can go door-to-door asking for some sugar.
segments.cn: 例如，有人可以挨家挨户地要糖。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Or we could say he is a door-to-door salesman.
segments.cn: 或者我们可以说他是一个挨家挨户的推销员。

segments.en: Door-to-door salesman.
segments.cn: 挨家挨户的推销员。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And now we have an interesting question and it's a very good one because it's a question that comes up a lot.
segments.cn: 现在我们有一个有趣的问题，这是一个非常好的问题，因为这个问题经常出现。

segments.en: When somebody asks you if you're studying, for example, what grade are you in?
segments.cn: 当有人问你是否在学习时，例如，你上几年级？

segments.en: Okay, what grade are you in?
segments.cn: 好吧，你上几年级？

segments.en: So in the American system, for example, we have the very, very bottom grade K, which is kindergarten for maybe a five-year-old.
segments.cn: 在美国系统中，例如，我们有非常底层的K年级，适合大约五岁的孩子。

segments.en: And at the very top we have high school grade 12.
segments.cn: 在最顶层我们有高中12年级。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And so in between we have one, two, three, four, five, you know, and up.
segments.cn: 所以在中间我们有一、二、三、四、五，等等。

segments.en: And so basically to find out what year in school a student is, you have to ask him or her what grade are you in.
segments.cn: 基本上要找出一个学生在学校的年级，你必须问他或她你上几年级。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So then the person would say, I'm in sixth grade, I'm in eighth grade.
segments.cn: 所以那个人会说，我上六年级，我上八年级。

segments.en: But this is the way you ask this question for a school, as you said, a kid that's maybe five years old all the way to 18 years old in high school.
segments.cn: 但这是你问这个问题的方式，适用于五岁到18岁上高中的孩子。

segments.en: What grade are you in?
segments.cn: 你上几年级？

segments.en: Now, if you're in university and you want to ask your friend what year of university that person's in, then you say... What year are you?
segments.cn: 现在，如果你在大学，想问你的朋友他上大学的哪一年，你就说... 你上几年？

segments.en: What year are you?
segments.cn: 你上几年？

segments.en: Yeah, you don't say grade.
segments.cn: 是的，你不说年级。

segments.en: So basically grade refers to like what you said, Marco, those first 12 years of school.
segments.cn: 所以基本上年级是指你所说的，马尔科，那12年的学校。

segments.en: And so we call them...
segments.cn: 所以我们称之为...

segments.en: So you could ask anybody under the age of 18, what grade are you in?
segments.cn: 所以你可以问任何18岁以下的人，你上几年级？

segments.en: But when you go to university or when you're talking about university students, it gets a little bit different.
segments.cn: 但当你去大学或谈论大学生时，就有点不同了。

segments.en: So you can say what year are you in or what year are you?
segments.cn: 所以你可以说你上几年或你上几年？

segments.en: So if you're not sure about someone's age and you maybe think they're in college, you can ask them, what year are you?
segments.cn: 如果你不确定某人的年龄，可能认为他们在大学，你可以问他们，你上几年？

segments.en: But generally, anyone under 18, what grade are you in?
segments.cn: 但一般来说，任何18岁以下的人，你上几年级？

segments.en: Okay, good.
segments.cn: 好的，好的。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And our last phrase, and this is kind of an expression, right?
segments.cn: 我们最后一个短语，这算是一种表达，对吧？

segments.en: Goodness sake, for goodness sake.
segments.cn: 天哪，真是的。

segments.en: Okay, so let's look at the context.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看上下文。

segments.en: The kids say, we're in grade seven, and the person at the door says, then for goodness sake, don't you see this sign?
segments.cn: 孩子们说，我们上七年级，门口的人说，那么天哪，你没看到这个标志吗？

segments.en: Right, for goodness sake.
segments.cn: 对，真是的。

segments.en: So this is an expression that's used to indicate maybe you're a little bit frustrated.
segments.cn: 这是一个用来表示你有点沮丧的表达。

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Right?
segments.cn: 对吧？

segments.en: So it's like, come on, or my goodness, or for Pete's sake.
segments.cn: 所以就像，快点，或者我的天，或者为了彼得的缘故。

segments.en: We have many ways of saying, all right, come on.
segments.cn: 我们有很多种说法，好的，快点。

segments.en: I'm a little tired of this.
segments.cn: 我有点厌倦了。

segments.en: Right, you're irritating me.
segments.cn: 对，你让我烦。

segments.en: Right, so basically the person's saying, you are too old for this.
segments.cn: 对，所以基本上那个人在说，你太大了，不应该这样。

segments.en: You're too old for this.
segments.cn: 你太大了。

segments.en: You should read what it says on my door.
segments.cn: 你应该看看我门上的标志。

segments.en: No soliciting.
segments.cn: 禁止推销。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And so the person's angry.
segments.cn: 所以那个人生气。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: The person's angry because these kids are trying to sell her something when clearly she has a sign that says no soliciting.
segments.cn: 那个人生气，因为这些孩子试图向她推销东西，而她显然有一个标志写着禁止推销。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, a lot of interesting phrases there.
segments.cn: 好吧，那里有很多有趣的短语。

segments.en: Why don't we go back, listen to our dialogue for the very last time, and we'll be back to talk with you a little bit more.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去，最后一次听我们的对话，然后我们再回来和你聊聊。

segments.en: Okay, Mark, it's your turn to ring the doorbell.
segments.cn: 好吧，马克，轮到你按门铃了。

segments.en: I did it last time.
segments.cn: 我上次按过了。

segments.en: I hate going door to door, and I hate asking for money.
segments.cn: 我讨厌挨家挨户，讨厌要钱。

segments.en: But we need to raise enough money for the school fundraiser so that our class can win the pizza party.
segments.cn: 但我们需要为学校筹款筹集足够的钱，这样我们的班级才能赢得比萨派对。

segments.en: You do want to have a pizza party, don't you?
segments.cn: 你想要比萨派对，对吧？

segments.en: Yes, but... Just go already.
segments.cn: 是的，但是... 快去吧。

segments.en: No one's coming.
segments.cn: 没人来。

segments.en: Try again.
segments.cn: 再试一次。

segments.en: Maybe there's no one home.
segments.cn: 也许家里没有人。

segments.en: Of course there's someone home.
segments.cn: 当然家里有人。

segments.en: There are two cars in the driveway, and I can see lights all in the house.
segments.cn: 车道上有两辆车，我能看到屋子里有灯光。

segments.en: Hello?
segments.cn: 你好？

segments.en: Anybody home?
segments.cn: 有人在吗？

segments.en: We would like to know if you want to sponsor us in our school fundraiser.
segments.cn: 我们想知道你是否愿意赞助我们的学校筹款活动。

segments.en: 50% of the profits go towards the new school playground.
segments.cn: 利润的50%将用于新的学校游乐场。

segments.en: I don't know why anyone would want what's in this catalogue anyway.
segments.cn: 我不知道为什么任何人会想要这个目录里的东西。

segments.en: It's just a bunch of tacky Christmas ornaments.
segments.cn: 这只是一堆俗气的圣诞装饰品。

segments.en: Cities of old people singing Christmas songs and special crackers and cheeses and boxes of chocolates.
segments.cn: 旧人唱圣诞歌的城市，还有特别的饼干和奶酪以及巧克力盒。

segments.en: You don't like chocolate?
segments.cn: 你不喜欢巧克力吗？

segments.en: Not this kind.
segments.cn: 不喜欢这种。

segments.en: They've got weird names like Ganache and Praline.
segments.cn: 它们有奇怪的名字，比如甘纳许和法式夹心糖。

segments.en: Look, I just saw someone walking around inside.
segments.cn: 看，我刚看到有人在里面走动。

segments.en: These people are being very rude.
segments.cn: 这些人很无礼。

segments.en: Finally, someone's coming.
segments.cn: 最后，有人来了。

segments.en: They don't look too happy.
segments.cn: 他们看起来不太高兴。

segments.en: Hi, sir, would you like to sponsor us or make a donation to... What grade are you kids in?
segments.cn: 你好，先生，你想赞助我们还是捐款给... 你们上几年级？

segments.en: Grade 7.
segments.cn: 七年级。

segments.en: Then for goodness sake, don't you see this sign?
segments.cn: 那么天哪，你没看到这个标志吗？

segments.en: Can't you read?
segments.cn: 你看不懂吗？

segments.en: No soliciting?
segments.cn: 不准推销？

segments.en: All right, so door-to-door salesmen.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以是逐户推销。

segments.en: I think this used to be a very American thing.
segments.cn: 我觉得这曾经是非常美国的事情。

segments.en: I think back in the 50s you would always see movies where this was actually a profession.
segments.cn: 我想在50年代，你总能看到电影中这实际上是一种职业。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: People would go door-to-door selling hair brushes or magazine subscriptions.
segments.cn: 人们会逐户推销发刷或杂志订阅。

segments.en: Pretty much everything.
segments.cn: 几乎所有东西。

segments.en: Yeah, you still see it sometimes.
segments.cn: 是的，有时你仍然能看到。

segments.en: Some people sell insurance or there are a lot of religious door-to-door salespeople who want to sell religious books or magazines.
segments.cn: 有些人卖保险，或者有很多宗教推销员想卖宗教书籍或杂志。

segments.en: But I think it was much more popular in the 1950s because people didn't really use their phones as much to sell things.
segments.cn: 但我觉得在1950年代更受欢迎，因为人们并不常用电话来卖东西。

segments.en: It was cheaper to have someone drive his car to your neighborhood and then go to every single house.
segments.cn: 让人开车到你所在的社区，然后去每一户人家是更便宜的。

segments.en: But yeah, it's a very interesting job.
segments.cn: 但这确实是个很有趣的工作。

segments.en: I think it'd be very lonely.
segments.cn: 我觉得会很孤独。

segments.en: And also I think, well, now maybe that's been reduced a lot because now you have the Internet.
segments.cn: 而且我觉得，现在可能已经减少很多，因为现在有互联网。

segments.en: Oh yeah, well the Internet means that the salespeople come to you without you having to get up.
segments.cn: 哦，是的，互联网意味着推销员可以不让你起身就来找你。

segments.en: So basically you're sitting at home in your pajamas and you can order a TV and some clothes.
segments.cn: 所以基本上你穿着睡衣坐在家里，可以订购电视和衣服。

segments.en: But it's very interesting because I remember you would have all these door-to-door salesmen.
segments.cn: 但这很有趣，因为我记得你会有很多逐户推销员。

segments.en: For example, I had one visit me once who was selling me encyclopedias.
segments.cn: 例如，我曾经有一个人来找我，推销百科全书。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: A big collection of like, I don't know, 37 books or more.
segments.cn: 一大套，像是37本书或更多。

segments.en: It was a huge amount of books, encyclopedias.
segments.cn: 那是一大堆书，百科全书。

segments.en: And I don't know if you see that anymore.
segments.cn: 我不知道你现在还看到这种情况吗。

segments.en: Not really, not in the States.
segments.cn: 不太可能，在美国没有。

segments.en: I don't know if anyone buys physical huge encyclopedias to have in their home.
segments.cn: 我不知道还有谁会买实体的大百科全书放在家里。

segments.en: No, only collectors perhaps.
segments.cn: 不，可能只有收藏家。

segments.en: Maybe.
segments.cn: 也许。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So it's a very interesting profession.
segments.cn: 所以这是个很有趣的职业。

segments.en: I don't know, in the United States, as you say, it's not very common anymore.
segments.cn: 我不知道，在美国，正如你所说，这已经不太常见了。

segments.en: Very little, maybe specific services.
segments.cn: 非常少，可能是特定服务。

segments.en: But this is interesting.
segments.cn: 但这很有趣。

segments.en: Maybe in your country, this is still a big thing.
segments.cn: 也许在你的国家，这仍然是个大事。

segments.en: Yeah, let us know.
segments.cn: 是的，让我们知道。

segments.en: In your country, are door-to-door salespeople still common?
segments.cn: 在你的国家，逐户推销员仍然常见吗？

segments.en: Do you see them?
segments.cn: 你能看到他们吗？

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: We hope to see you there.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那里见到你。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Bye-bye.
segments.cn: 再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
